page.title: 02Farming around Great Barford
page.content: Farming today is highly mechanised with machinery to do every thing. Crops are set and harvested by machines. Grain is stored in huge bins and dried by blowing warm air though it.Most of the grain in this area is top quality and sold for seeds all over the world.The majority of crops are cereal.Two of the newest crops which are grown profusely are tick beans for animal food and rape seed which produces oil for margarine and cosmetics. There are still tenant farmers who have small holdings growing market garden produce but unfortunatly these are disappearing as they are being takenover by large farming syndicates. Sheep and cattle are reared for their meat and are grazed on the hilly meadows by the river.
